entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 4:24PM AKST until November 23 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 20 at 9:34AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PM-10 HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR RILLITO (NEAR MARANA) TUESDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued a PM-10 High Pollution Advisory for Rillito (near Marana) area Tuesday. An episode of strong and gusty winds is forecast to generate widespread blowing dust that may result in local PM-

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 7:45PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A period of snow and sleet expected this evening...changing to a mix of rain and freezing rain through midnight... Snow and sleet has moved into the Capital Region, Rensselaer Plateau, southern Vermont and Berkshires, occasionally moderate at times. An inch or less of snow is expected through this evening, especially on grassy surfaces and untreated surfaces.

Northerly wind gusting 20 to 30 mph. * WHERE...Northern and southeast portions of the Bighorn Basin. * WHEN...5 AM Thanksgiving through Friday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Bighorn Basin; Southeast Bighorn Basin

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 1:24PM MST until November 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS

entry.cap:areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 1:24PM MST until November 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches. Northerly wind gusting 20 to 30 mph, possibly increasing to around 40 mph Thursday night at the southern end of the mountain range. * WHERE...East Slope of the Wind River Mountains.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 1:24PM MST until November 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Upper Wind River Basin, including Dubois. * WHEN...5 AM Thanksgiving through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult late Thanksgiving

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 1:24PM MST until November 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Northerly wind gusting 20 to 35 mph. * WHERE...Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range, including Jeffrey City.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 1:24PM MST until November 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Northerly wind gusting 20 to 35 mph, possibly as high as 35 to 45 mph between Moneta and Hiland. * WHERE...Natrona County.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 12:41PM MST until November 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches possible with the lower amounts up north toward the Montana border and the higher amounts around Gillette. * WHERE...Northern Campbell County.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued November 21 at 12:41PM MST until November 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches possible. * WHERE...Southern Campbell County and the Weston County Plains. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Friday afternoon.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued November 21 at 12:09PM MST until November 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County
